result.execSummary:
The defendant Tanner M. Sorum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:
$518.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
6 mos. in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive. Forthwith
EMP authorized
May transfer to Dane Co. or Dodge Co.
Provide DNA Sample
Paperwork handed in court.
from defendant & response from Court
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Raabe advises matter has been discussed and will be set for argued sentencing with Br. 3.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference on March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Return date on April 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Raabe recently appointed.  Request PTC/rd.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-26-2016 11:45 am.
Return date at 03-08-2016 01:00 pm.

Atty Middleton makes argument re: motion filed on 2/1/2016.  State responds against the motion.  Atty Middleton responds/DE will remain in custody until June 2016 regardless, this will simply allow him to exercise huber privileges.  Requests bond be amended to signature bond.  Court grants motion for bond modification and amends previously ordered cash bond to a $1,000.00 signature bond.  Court admonishes DE that leaving the jail w/o permission is escape under certain circumstances.

Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Parties to do prelim time limit waiver and argue a motion today.  Atty Middleton agrees that DE will waive the time limits for the prelim.  DE agrees.  Court accepts time limit waiver and sets for PTC and RD.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 11:45 am.  Return date scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant Tanner M. Sorum in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant recv'd and waives reading of complaint.  State requests $1000.00 Cash bond.  Atty. ORourke makes bond argument for PA bond.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $500.00 Cash bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.
